I have to be convinced that this year is just building up the abnoxious shit so that at the end it can be really spectacular. I mean winning the goddamn lottery spectacular. For those of you that haven't been talking to me all that frequently my grandmother Goomba (Rosalene) died last Sunday in hospice. Which, she should have been at home, but I only have my stupid aunt to thank for that. I hate hospics, and will be angry with her for that for a long time to come. And, yet it my other aunt is who I'm even angrier at. I can understand the one though she was doing the right thing, and even though I vehemetly disagree with her I can understand that. My other aunt however at the funeral service pulled something I can't honestly believe. So, my mother and sister make a slideshow of all sorts of family pictures to play at the funeral. They were told that the place wasn't set up for that. Then during the service there is a slide show of pictures. Well that in and of itself is kinda sketchy, but wait it gets better. So, there is no family in the pictures with my grandmother just people that she worked with for 30 odd years which is fine, and then the very last slide is my stupid fucking aunt and my grandmother. That's it! she was the only family in the whole thing! My grandmother didn't even like this women(she is the wife of her eldest son). So, the burial is on monday (today now), and I will have to resist the urge to put that women in some unmarked grave while I'm there. Also, she was the only family member who spoke at the funeral for some reason. Read some damn biblical passage whoo ha that nobody gave a damn about anyway. Stupid vapid whore.


        Well, now that is off my chest... I have been playing a lot of disgaea lately that game really has no right to be that much fun. I have been reading like crazy, and just finished mistborn by Brandon Sanderson. It was a pretty entertaining read, and I would recomend it. I mean his name illeterates! it's reason enough I tell you. The website is this. I will now have to read those short story anthologies I picked up when I went to the library. The best of the best science fiction so far is very promising.

    I am so glad that it is spring break! and now I think I'm going to scamper off.

I'm sitting here at school and instead of doing something responsible that even resembles work I'm reading webcomics and looking at live journal. I totally don't feel like I am done with school, and I wouldn't know spring fever if it bit me. Unfortunatly, I fear that spring fever has bitten me... Hard in the face. I'd be more upset, but let's face it the teeth marks can only further distract from looking at the face as a whole, and that can't be a bad thing. 

     As for that rant about day light savings time, or stealing an hour of spring! I love spring and hate the fall. So this constant demand to steal an hour of srping and replace it with an hour of fall to me is monstrous. Not that in all reality it actually changes the amount of either season. I do appreciate the light later in the day, but trying to get up in the morning when it's dark out was damn near impossible this morning. I find the history of how daylight savings time came into being to be particularly humorous. If anyone ever tells you it was to benifit the farmers they are filled with lies. In all actuality daylight savings time hurts farmers, but it is great for retail. Now the arguement is that it is good for energy efficiency. Which, I  suppose makes sence how many people are up at 7pm vs 5am? 

     Well i better get to doing some "fake" work. stupid spoon donkey. This drawing portion is killing me! Mostly because I can't really draw.

    I just finished Neverwhere, and I'm not sure how much I liked it. Don't get me wrong it was a very enjoyable read, but something about it just wasn't as satisfying as it could be. I can't put my finger on it. Neil Gaiman your books are good, but confusing to me. I like them but something about them always seems off. Unless you are being balanced with an experienced author. American Gods had two plots, and dragged a bit in the middle. I think the problem with Neverwhere is the main character Richard. I suppose he is the reluctant hero which, is a hard character to write well. Gaiman carries it off fairly well, but something is lacking. Oh well, I hate it when I can't pinpoint what I don't like. I will have to think on it.

Since Live Journal has decided to blight the top of the page with a Valentine theme splash I will get into my valentine rant. Though it will wait until after I discuss my day. Today started off amazing, and then turned wonderfully worse as I lost my phone (soon recovered) and then later locked my keys in the lab (narrowly rescued by becca). All in all though I have to say it turned out pretty damn good. I talked with people I like through out the day, and I made it Home in time for House and Boston Legal.

    Now, on to Valentines day accursed hallmark holiday of the damned. This will be the first Valentines day that I will not be single for. In a odd and sick way that almost makes me sad. Not that it really matters I'll be sitting at home doing homework after my lab meeting. In which case the only Valentine I can really think of seeing tomorrow is Mike handing me my own beating heart back to me on the plate next to my ass. That doesn't mean it's Valentines day so much as Wednesday. The holiday is so contrived. Nothing like being spontaneously romantic on the same day every one else is doing it. It's a sad day in which wives are forcing there husbands to do something nice for them, and making it pathetically easy to do so. You should do things for you partner through out the year. If they only express romantic gestures for you on the given holidays it's sad and depressing. Well, it makes a ton of money so it's not like it is ever going away. I better get used to it. Next holiday rant St. Patrick's day where everybody is a little bit Irish except the gays and the Italians.

My stupid Interpersonal Communication class is gettting some kind of aggrivating, and even with its insightful knowledge base at my disposal I fell I will never truly learn to say that everytime you open your mouth I want to jab a pen in your eye. At least with the full texture of meaning I want. It's not like the class is hard in any facet of the imagination, but is so meaningless that everytime I leave I feel the urge to commit random attrocities on strangers to amuse myself. Not that this is really very likely as it takes far to much effort. The thought entertains me enough.  The micro econ class is still entertaining. The amorality of economics is so sexy. 

    Now the real reason I'm going on about my classes aside from the need to vent. My folklore class, which is generally amazing, is going to make me do a project on folklore. Now, I know this comes as a suprise to everyone I'm sure. The fun and interesting part is it is a project in which I collect some modern folklore from a group and do some papers on it. So, I have to go out and activily collect some material. I'm still not exactly sure which group to do, but it will be some nerdy subgroup I'm sure. As I know only nerds really you will all (the three of you that read this) to give me some material, and preferably enlist your friends. Some ideas for groups include Anime conventions, something to do with fanfiction, somethign to do with webcomics, or table top gamers. I'll get back to everyone on details but I figured I would send out the warning first.

The geneva convention only let's me get away with so much before it's a war crime.

Tonight the driveway won. Which, is made sweeter by the fact that the weather is absolute and total shit. So, I won't be going to laramie this weekend like I had originally planned. Also, I think i'm getting sick. Scratch that I am getting sick , and am hell bound and determined to make it as fast and easy as possible. So I'm currently enjoying some miso soup. 

So, I'm at work, and decide to take a break from reading my economics (the sexy social science) book to read something else. Keeping in mind I don't really need to be reading it except for my own pleasure. One can only handle so much of it at a time. I go over to the community book/magazene share and pick up the GQ sitting in the basket. GQ is essentially targeted towards new york metrosexuals, and like most magazines that specialize in such smell horrendous. I picked this one up as it had a picture of Jake Gyllenhall on the cover (for the record I HATE, loathe, and dislike Brokeback mountain) and some story about gays in Iraq ( which was mildly interesting and terribly depressing. So, flipping through the GQ which usually promises some eyecandy I get to the section on politics. It's a story about Tom Coburn (US Senate R <http://coburn.senate.gov/public/> ), and was actually very entertaining. I'm a fiscal conservative and a social liberal. Which essentially means that I am wholly represented by 0 people in legislature. Though I don't think that anyone is truly represented. You just kind of vote and hope things even out in the end. I don't like the mans social policy (christian conservative), but anyone who can get up as a freshman senator and try to remove a essentially useless 200 million dollar bridge and make senators own up to 700 million dollar kickbacks (in essence) appropriated into bills. This done while running his medical practice for free on weekends gets a tip of the hat to be sure. Just figured I would mention that as it was interesting.

Ugh, I hate being sick, and tomorrow brings with it shoveling and potentially dinner out with my parents (whom I do love). As for a weekend spent enjoying friends and my health... I can only hope to get my room clean, and meet up with some people sometime. 

Quick note: Curse you Devin! this is awesome <http://lackadaisy.foxprints.com/>

Of course I never update this thing, and I think that I have figured out why. Firstly, at home I usually have something better to distract me from doing homework ie: anything but this thats not work. Secondly, I try not to do homework ever, and I'm not exactly sure when it gets done, but it surely isn't right now. Actually my homework gets done during my work ethic power hour! These past few days have been trying times, and I find myself looking to these keys for solace. My mother and Father have embarked on their journey to my grandmothers bedside. They will spend the remainder of the week caring for my grandfather whilst my grandmother recuperates in the hospital. I remain vigilant at the household caring for my younger sibling. The experience has proved to be less harrowing as I first suspected. We seem to function under an armistice during the absence of our parents. The cat is doing decidedly better. 

Yesterday I accompanied the ladies <lj user=inamoment> and <lj user=obsidianfawn> to the southern lake shore in the evening light. The excursion was a scintillating experience for the senses. In the faded light the lapping of and brisk breeze through the grass was the music that assailed our ears. Eyes met with the sight of distant lightning while the earth clung to our shoes. A combination of the elements that few take the time to appreciate as they should.
